sub_topic: Prove that every group of order 30 is isomorphic to either the cyclic group C30, the dihedral group D15, or the non-abelian group of order 30.
message_1: Let G be a group of order 30. If G is isomorphic to the cyclic group C30, how many generators does G have?
message_2:
A group G is isomorphic to the cyclic group C30 if there exists a bijection (one-to-one and onto) function between the elements of G and C30 that preserves the group operation. In this case, G is also a cyclic group of order 30.

The number of generators of a cyclic group of order n is given by the Euler's totient function φ(n), which counts the number of positive integers less than or equal to n that are relatively prime to n (i.e., their greatest common divisor is 1).

For n = 30, we can find the prime factors of 30: 30 = 2 × 3 × 5. Now, we can compute the Euler's totient function φ(30) using the formula:

φ(n) = n × (1 - 1/p1) × (1 - 1/p2) × ... × (1 - 1/pk),

where p1, p2, ..., pk are the distinct prime factors of n.

In our case, φ(30) = 30 × (1 - 1/2) × (1 - 1/3) × (1 - 1/5) = 30 × (1/2) × (2/3) × (4/5) = 8.

So, the group G has 8 generators.
